meanings.definition: The simultaneous broadcasting of the same program on radio and television.
meanings.sent1: During the simulcasting, the show was on both TV and radio at once.
meanings.sent2: The simulcasting of the sports event allowed fans to watch it on different devices.
meanings.sent3: The simulcasting mix-up made everyone hear the news on their TVs and radios together.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the room like a simulcasting of music and talk shows.
meanings.sent5: The magic of simulcasting made it seem like the show was everywhere at once.

meanings.definition: The transmission of a program across multiple platforms at the same time.
meanings.sent1: Simulcasting the event on various platforms helped reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent2: The company's simulcasting strategy involved streaming on different websites simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The simulcasting of the movie on all screens turned the cinema into a digital wonderland.
meanings.sent4: His words spread like a simulcasting virus across social media platforms.
meanings.sent5: The power of simulcasting brought the event to everyone's screens in real-time.
